newsitem.title: USA: USDA buys 2.91 mln lbs frozen pork for programs.
newsitem.headline: USDA buys 2.91 mln lbs frozen pork for programs.

text.p: The Agricultural Marketing Service of the U.S. Department of Agriculture said it purchased 2,905,200 pounds of frozen pork products on Thursday at a cost of approximately $4,310,000.
The purchase will be used for distribution in the National School Lunch Program and other Federal food assistance programs.
Total purchases of frozen pork since the program was announced on August 19 follow:
Awards made for Announcement LS-50, Invitation 18, to be shipped between Dec 16, 1996 and Jan 10, 1997.

Winning bidders for the coarse ground pork were American Foods Group (Huran SD) 118,800 lbs, Bo Packing Co (Chicago IL) 356,400 lbs, H&H Meat Products Co (Mercedes TX) 39,600 lbs, IBP Inc (Storm Lake and Columbus Junc'n IA) 554,400 lbs.
Awards made for Announcement LS-50, Invitation 19, to be shipped between Dec 28, 1996 and Jan 10, 1997.

Winning bidders for frozen smoked-fully cooked hams were American Foods Group (Mitchell SD) 1.512 million lbs, Clougherty Packing Co (Los Angeles CA) 36,000 lbs, John Morrell and Co (Great Bend KS and Sioux Fallls SD) 288,000 lbs.
